p:
Today’s global society is dependent on water resources for sustainable development
1 , but water security is under severe threat from combined pressures; human actions have become the main driver of global environmental change
2, 3 . This calls for better understanding of the cause and effect relationships and co-evolution between water resources and humans
4– 6 . We may soon be approaching the planet’s boundaries for global freshwater use
7 and there is empirical evidence for ongoing intensification of the water cycle due to climate change
8, 9 . For parts of the globe, however, direct human impacts on the water cycle still exceed impacts from global warming
10, 11 .
